official-title.#text: To protect the separation of powers in the Constitution of the United States by ensuring that the President takes care that the laws be faithfully executed, and for other purposes.

attestation-date.#text: Passed the House of Representatives March 12, 2014.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Executive Needs to Faithfully Observe and Respect Congressional Enactments of the Law Act of 2014
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Executive Needs to Faithfully Observe and Respect Congressional Enactments of the Law Act of 2014

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

header.#text: Authorization to bring civil action for violation of the take care clause

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: , the head of any department or agency of the United States, or any other officer or employee of the United States has established or implemented a formal or informal policy, practice, or procedure to refrain from enforcing, applying, following, or administering any provision of a Federal statute, rule, regulation, program, policy, or other law in violation of the requirement that the President take care that the laws be faithfully executed under Article II, section 3, clause 5, of the Constitution of the United States, that House is authorized to bring a civil action in accordance with
, and to seek relief pursuant to
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Executive Needs to Faithfully Observe and Respect Congressional Enactments of the Law Act of 2014/s:2/ss:c

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: . A civil action brought pursuant to this subsection may be brought by a single House or both Houses of Congress jointly, if both Houses have adopted such a resolution.

text.#text: Upon the adoption of a resolution of a House of Congress declaring that the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Executive Needs to Faithfully Observe and Respect Congressional Enactments of the Law Act of 2014/s:2/ss:a

quote.#text: Relating to the application of Article II, section 3, clause 5, of the Constitution of the United States.

text.#text: the title of which is as follows:
which does not have a preamble; and

quote.#tail: (the blank spaces being appropriately filled in with the
quote.#text: That _______ has failed to meet the requirement of Article II, section 3, clause 5, of the Constitution of the United States to take care that a law be faithfully executed, with respect to _________.

text.#text: the matter after the resolving clause which is as follows:

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: or the person on behalf of the President, and the administrative action in question described in

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Executive Needs to Faithfully Observe and Respect Congressional Enactments of the Law Act of 2014/s:2/ss:a

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: brings a civil action pursuant to

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Executive Needs to Faithfully Observe and Respect Congressional Enactments of the Law Act of 2014/s:2/ss:a

text.#text: The action shall be filed in a United States district court of competent jurisdiction and shall be heard by a 3-judge court convened pursuant to

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: . Such appeal shall be taken by the filing of a notice of appeal within 10 days, and the filing of a jurisdictional statement within 30 days, of the entry of the final decision.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Supreme Court of the United States

text.#text: A final decision in the action shall be reviewable only by appeal directly to the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: to advance on the docket and to expedite to the greatest possible extent the disposition of any such action and appeal.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Supreme Court of the United States

text.#text: It shall be the duty of the United States district courts and the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Comptroller General of the United States
Committees on the Judiciary of the House of Representatives

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: , a report on the costs of any civil action brought pursuant to this Act, including any attorney fees of any attorney that has been hired to provide legal services in connection with a civil action brought pursuant to this Act.

text.#text: Not later than the last day of the first fiscal year quarter that begins after the date of the enactment of this Act, and quarterly thereafter, the

{http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/}title.#text: 113 HR 4138 EH: ENFORCE the Law Act of 2014
